VLIB Function Reference

L2 Normalization

Introduction and Use Cases

L2 normalization computes the norm (also known as distance, or magnitude) of an n dimensional vector. L2 normalization is also referred to as: Euclidean length, L2 distance, l2 distance, L2 norm, or l2 norm.

Specification

Variants

This functionality is available in four input format variants:
  • 8-bit : VLIB_L2_norm_i8
  • 16-bit : VLIB_L2_norm_i16
  • 32-bit : VLIB_L2_norm_i32
  • 32-bit float: VLIB_L2_norm_f32

Inputs


    Parameter    Description                        8-bit   16-bit     32-bit    float
    -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    pData[]      Array of data buffer              (UQ8.0)  (UQ16.0)  (UQ32.0)  (VLIB_F32)
    len          Length of the input array         (SQ31.0) (SQ31.0)  (SQ31.0)  (SQ31.0)

Outputs

    Returns floating point norm value
    - For 8/16/32 bit integer input types, the output is F32
    - For float input type, the output is D64

Method

The L2 Norm is computed by taking the square root of the sum of squares of each value in the input array:
  • sqrt( pData[0]^2 + pData[1]^2 + ... + pData[len-1]^2 )

APIS

  • VLIB_L2_norm_i8
  • VLIB_L2_norm_i16
  • VLIB_L2_norm_i32
  • VLIB_L2_norm_f32

References

  1. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norm_%28mathematics%29
